Key Match Events: Argentina opened the scoring in the second half with Julián Álvarez's goal in the 49th minute
Lautaro Martínez sealed the win for Argentina with a goal in the 88th minute
Maxime Crépeau made an outstanding save on Di Maria's one-on-one opportunity in the first half
Crépeau made another outrageous stop around the 65th minute as Messi brought down a long ball on the counter-attack
Pre-Game Insights: Canada played the same side that drew 0-0 with France in a friendly
Argentina played arguably their strongest possible side, with Lionel Messi and Ángel Di María flanking Julián Alvárez up front
Post-Match Reflections: Canada's goalkeeper Maxime Crépeau deserved a heap of praise for his performance
Davies said in his postmatch interview that he was disappointed with the result
Canada will be desperate to get their first victory on a major international stage
Miscellaneous Highlights: Argentina's coach Lionel Scaloni opted to take Di María out and replace him with midfielder Giovani Lo Celso
Canada won 56 per cent of the duels in the first half, winning 73 per cent of their attempted tackles
Others: Canada's next match is against Peru this Tuesday, June 25 at Kansas City's Children's Mercy Park
Argentina's Group A journey continues against Chile later that same evening
